definition: (once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult

sentences.english: Simple cysts are difficult to distinguish from arachnoid cyst or epidermoid.
sentences.chinese: 单纯的囊肿较难与蛛网膜囊肿和表皮样囊肿相鉴别。

sentences.english: But this is still difficult to prove.
sentences.chinese: 但是这仍然是很难证明的。

sentences.english: Wasn't it quite tough to get into that course in UCLA?
sentences.chinese: 能进到UCLA学这门课很难吧？
雨后的道路变得十分难走。

sentences.english: At the very least, that will make it hard for a future President to keep tax-cut promises.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎样，下一任总统将很难兑现他们减税的承诺。

sentences.english: This paper tries to explore the application of fine powder technology to Chinese medicinal herbs and insoluble medicines.
sentences.chinese: 本文就难溶药物与中草药微细化技术作出探索性研究。

sentences.english: I know it's hard, Linna, but you can do it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这很难，琳娜，但是你可以做到。

sentences.english: Indeed, pain and itch have been difficult to separate.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，疼痛和瘙痒一直以来都很难分开。

sentences.english: Culture is a difficult concept to pin down.
sentences.chinese: 文化是一个非常难讲清楚的概念。

sentences.english: A secure, memorable password is easy for you to remember, and hard for others to guess.
sentences.chinese: 安全可靠又难以遗忘的密码应该是易记且难猜的。

sentences.english: It is easier to square the circle than to get round a mathematician.
sentences.chinese: 从数学家面前混过去比“化圆为方”还难。

sentences.english: Sometimes trying to find something on the worldwide web is like trying to find a needle in a haystack.
sentences.chinese: 有时候在互联网上找东西就和大海捞针一样难。

sentences.english: I think it"s hard to believe."
You may have heard that some foods, because they are difficult to digest, will make you lose weight.
sentences.chinese: 你一定听说过那些难消化所以会使你体重减轻的食品。

sentences.english: The only guy who was hard to get to know was Richie Gaspari.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的家伙谁是很难了解的是里奇斯帕里。

sentences.english: Buckle up, it may harder for aliens to suck you out of your car.
sentences.chinese: 系好安全带，这样外形人也更难把你从车子里抓走。

definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
lit. even harder than reaching the sky (idiom)/fig. extremely difficult/far from an easy task
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
